description.raw:
[This](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/8865/gazebo_clienthh-not-found/?answer=8870#post-id-8870) question pointed out a problem with file versioning in tutorials. This pull request should fix the references for that specific tutorial, but I'm sure there must be similar problems in other tutorials.

The diff looks big but all that was done was:

1. Rename `tutorial.md` to `tutorial_1-9.md`, since that was the version it represented

2. Copied `tutorial_2-2.md` to `tutorial.md` since that seemed to reflect the most updated version

3. Changed `default` to `gazebo_2.2` in the bitbucket links for `tutorial_2-2.md`.

I think the solution here is not ideal because the gazebo6+ tutorial still points to default. We should make sure to update these links once gazebo6 is released.

Another thing I noticed is that tutorials automatically open at the most recent version, in this case, it will open at gazebo6, which is not ideal for users.

I think the solution here is not ideal because the gazebo6+ tutorial still points to default. We should make sure to update these links once gazebo6 is released.

Another thing I noticed is that tutorials automatically open at the most recent version, in this case, it will open at gazebo6, which is not ideal for users.
